intro: Cyrtandra septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
